author: lukaszrozmej
content:
do I understand correctly that with eip-4488, we stop pricing 0-bytes differently and just price all bytes the same?

This is how the reference Geth implementation does now: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/compare/master...quilt:calldata-eip?expand=1#diff-8c398ef0a79f97ba6d497a99247a815b3a51918de9e16954215b6073f907c92eR128-R133

author: potuz
content:
Yep, from the EIP
```
Reduce the gas cost of transaction calldata to NEW_CALLDATA_GAS_COST per byte, regardless of whether the byte is zero or nonzero.
```

author: robocopsgonemad
content: 65/67 of those blocks > 1MB of calldata happened between Jan 12 and Jan 13th 2020. Weird.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> they they were almost certainly a part of the starkware experiment
https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-2028-transaction-data-gas-cost-reduction/3280/35?u=djrtwo

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> > On January 12 2020 (after Istanbul and Muir Glacier), we repeated the experiment. Thus, StarkWare is also responsible for the new Big Red Dot.

author: terra854
content: Juat checking here, for EIP 4444, what happens to tx data after one year has passed? Is there like an option to keep it for archiving purposes or it's gone forever (at least for the local copy)?

author: .vbuterin
content: Nodes can choose to keep it longer

author: .vbuterin
content: And if a client wants to get that history, they could use a light client protocol to do that

author: vorot93
content: the idea was to make it unavailable over devp2p

author: vorot93
content: or at least over `eth` devp2p subprotocol

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Anyone know what the deal is with Kovan today?  No new blocks on etherscan in an hour, we are ahead of what they report but peering is super spotty (most nodes only have 2-3 peers).  I'm not sure where Kovan is discussed these days so asking here, if someone can point me to the proper place thanks!

author: timbeiko
content: I _think_ XDAI has taken over OE maintenance, but it's a bit unclear. I'd assume this includes Kovan. Their discord has an #openethereum channel.
